importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the recall of Colombia's ambassador to the U.S., marking the latest escalation in diplomatic tensions between Colombia and the United States.
The previous recall of the Colombian ambassador in July, following U.S. actions against Colombia's diplomatic mission, showing a recurring pattern of diplomatic friction.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period immediately following the U.S. missile attacks on drug-smuggling vessels and the subsequent diplomatic recall, indicating active and escalating tensions between the two nations.

keyTakeAways: Colombia has recalled its ambassador to the United States, Daniel García-Peña, for consultations, signaling a significant diplomatic rupture.
The recall follows U.S. accusations that Colombia is a hub for illegal drug production and that President Gustavo Petro supports drug trafficking.
U.S. President Donald Trump has accused Petro of being an 'illegal drug leader' and threatened to end financial subsidies and raise tariffs on Colombian exports.

The U.S. has launched a series of military operations in the Caribbean, including missile attacks on vessels allegedly transporting drugs, resulting in at least 30 deaths and accusations from Colombia that some victims were Colombian citizens.
This is the second time Colombia has recalled its ambassador to Washington this year, indicating deepening diplomatic hostility.
Colombia claims the U.S. actions constitute violations of sovereignty and potential acts of aggression, accusing the U.S. of targeting Colombian nationals and undermining bilateral relations.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Colombia has recalled its ambassador to the United States, Daniel García-Peña, for consultations, amid escalating tensions over drug trafficking, U.S. military actions in the Caribbean, and accusations that President Gustavo Petro supports drug production. The move follows a previous diplomatic recall in July and comes after U.S. President Donald Trump accused Petro of being a drug trafficker and threatened to cut financial subsidies and raise tariffs on Colombian goods. The U.S. has conducted missile attacks on seven vessels allegedly involved in drug trafficking, resulting in at least 30 deaths, with Colombia claiming some victims were Colombian nationals and accusing the U.S. of violating sovereignty and committing acts of aggression.
title: Colombian ambassador to US recalled to Bogotá for consultations, embassy says
